text: How do I determine an open file's size in Python?
There's a file that I would like to make sure does not grow larger than 2 GB (as it must run on a system that uses ext 2).
What's a good way to check a file's size bearing in mind that I will be writing to this file in between checks?
In particular, do I need to worry about buffered, unflushed changes that haven't been written to disk yet?
